summary: This bill, the Mental Health in Aviation Act of 2025, mandates the FAA to update regulations regarding mental health for aviation personnel. It aims to encourage individuals to seek mental healthcare and disclose conditions, while also implementing recommendations from relevant committees/task forces. The bill addresses annual reviews of special issuance processes, authorizes funding for specialized medical examiners, and initiates a public information campaign to reduce stigma. It also defines key terms and specifies reporting requirements.
